passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 21.00 HKD | Price: 15.25 HKD

Zhongsheng (ZS) 1H25 revenue came in at RMB77bn, down 6% YoY. New- car revenue fell 5% YoY to RMB58bn. New- car volume - 2% YoY, while blended ASP - 3% YoY. New- car sales GPM was down 0.8ppt YoY/2.2ppt HoH to - 4.1% (traditional brands at - 4.7%; AITO brand at - 3.4%). Of note, ZS recorded 11k units AITO volume sales with 3.4% GPM in 1H25, including 8k units sales (GPM=4.5%) and 3k units pure delivery (GPM=0.5%).

Used- car volume was up 10% YoY to 111k units, while profit per vehicle was RMB2.4k in 1H25 (vs. RMB 6.6k in 1H24), dragged by older car ages amid trade- in policy. AM revenue rose 0.1% YoY to RMB13.4bn with GPM up 0.3ppt YoY at 47.4%. AM includes (1) maintenance, warranty, collision (revenue +4% YoY to RMB11.4bn, GPM +1.6ppt YoY to 47.5%, aided by rising AM contribution of luxury brands, better supply chain mgmt); (2) auxiliary services (revenue -20% YoY to RMB1.9bn, GPM -6.0ppt YoY to 46.5%). 1H25 commission income was RMB1.8bn, down 5% YoY. 1H25 net income was RMB1.0bn, down 36% YoY, missed expectation but still decent results among auto dealers.

For 2H25, we expect ZS's net income to improve 15% HoH to RMB1.2bn vs RMB1bn in 1H25, driven by (1) more AITO sales (gross profit c. RMB0.2bn in 2H25E vs. RMB0.1bn in 1H25); (2) more additional rebate provided by OEMs in 2H; (3) slightly narrowing new- car price discount partially offset by lower auto finance commission; (4) higher AM profit due to seasonality. Looking into 2026, we expect RMB3bn net profit (+40% YoY), aided by (1) AITO to create RMB0.5bn gross profit; (2) legacy brands new car GPM to remain at - 4.2%; (3) AM (maintenance, warranty, collision) gross profit to post 8% YoY growth.

Factoring in 1H25 results, we cut our 2025/26E net income by 46%/43%. We apply target P/E of 15x to 2026E EPS (rolled over from 2025E) and lift PO to HKD21 (was HKD18.8). 15x is 1SD above ZS's five- year historical average, reflecting its rising EV and AM business, and likely turnaround in legacy brand new car sales. We used 10x (historical average) previously. We reiterate Buy for ZS's AM & EV sales as new growth drivers.

Autos/Car Manufacturers

Company DescriptionZhongsheng is China's largest auto dealer by profit (as of 2024) and by market cap. Its portfolio comprises both luxury (e.g., Mercedes-Benz and Lexus) and mid- to high- end auto brands (e.g., Toyota, Nissan, and Honda). The company had a total of 436 dealership stores by end 2024. Specifically, Zhongsheng is the second- largest dealer of Mercedes- Benz and the largest of Lexus in China.

We have a Buy rating on Zhongsheng, as we like its (1) brand exposure to Mercedes, Lexus, BMW and Toyota to offer reasonable new car margin, (2) new growth drivers in electric vehicle brand (AITO), aftermarket and used car businesses, (3) prudent financial strategies to protect its from industry downcycle.
1H25 net income was RMB1.0bn, down 36% YoY, market expectation
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
We cut our 2025/26E net income by 46%/43%.
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
Exhibit 3:P&L summary (half year) Forecast 2026 net income to rise by \(40\%\) YoY
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH

Our PO is HKD21. We apply target P/E of 15x to 2026E EPS. 15x is 1SD above ZS's five- year historical average, reflecting its rising EV business, growing AM business, and likely turnaround in traditional brand new car sales.
Upside risks: better- than- expected auto sales, improvement in gross profit margin.
Downside risks: slower- than- expected auto sales, fierce competition narrowing new cars margin
